etymology.description: 𠘧 (hand) + 又 (tool) = depicts hand holding a tool -> borrowed meaning of bamboo halberd
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a hand holding a tool, suggesting the action of beating. It was later borrowed to refer to a specific type of weapon, a bamboo halberd.

examples.chinese: 古代战场上(古代戰場上)，殳曾被视为关键武器(殳曾被視為關鍵武器)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhànchǎng shàng, shū céng bèi shì wéi guānjiàn wǔqì.
examples.english: On ancient battlefields, the shū was once considered a crucial weapon.

examples.chinese: 兵器展览中(兵器展覽中)，殳闪耀着历史的光芒(殳閃耀著歷史的光芒)。
examples.pinyin: Bīngqì zhǎnlǎn zhōng, shū shǎnyào zhe lìshǐ de guāngmáng.
examples.english: In the arms exhibition, the shū shone with the brilliance of history.
